entry.title: The Plant Health (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: This Order amends the Plant Health Order (Northern Ireland) 2006 (S.I. 2006/82) (“the principal Order”) so as to implement the instruments below—

title.div: The Assembly Learning Grants and Loans (Higher Education) (Wales) Regulations 2008 / Rheoliadau Grantiau a Benthyciadau Dysgu y Cynulliad (Addysg Uwch) (Cymru) 2008

div.p: These Regulations provide for financial support for students who are ordinarily resident in Wales taking designated higher education courses in respect of academic years beginning on or after 1 September 2008. They consolidate, with some changes, the Assembly Learning Grants and Loans (Higher Education) (Wales) Regulations 2007, as amended.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn darparu ar gyfer cymorth ariannol i fyfyrwyr sy'n preswylio fel arfer yng Nghymru ac sy'n dilyn cyrsiau addysg uwch dynodedig mewn perthynas â blynyddoedd academaidd sy'n dechrau ar neu ar ôl 1 Medi 2008. Maent yn cydgrynhoi, gyda rhai newidiadau, Reoliadau Grantiau a Benthyciadau Dysgu y Cynulliad (Addysg Uwch) (Cymru) 2007, fel y'u diwygiwyd.

entry.title: The Home Information Pack (Amendment)(No. 2) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Home Information Pack (No. 2) Regulations 2007 (“the principal Regulations”). Under sections 155 to 159 of the Housing Act 2004, a home information pack must comply with the principal Regulations.

entry.title: The School Admissions (Alteration and Variation of, and Objections to, Arrangements) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 90(9)(a) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (SSFA) and come into force on 28th May 2008.

entry.title: The Local Government and Public Involvement in Health Act 2007 (Commencement No. 6 and Transitional and Saving Provision) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order commences further provisions of the Local Government and Public Involvement in Health Act 2007 (c.28) (“the 2007 Act”).

entry.title: The Offender Management Act 2007 (Approved Premises) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the regulation, management and inspection of premises approved under section 13 of the Offender Management Act 2007 (c.21). Approved premises may be provided by a probation trust, by a local probation board or by another type of body.

entry.title: The Mental Health (Cross-border Visits) (Scotland) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in connection with escorted mental health patients who visit Scotland whilst on leave of absence under the law of England and Wales, Northern Ireland, the Isle of Man or any of the Channel Islands (“a relevant territory”).

entry.title: The Primary Care Trusts and National Health Service Trusts (Membership and Procedure) Amendment Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Primary Care Trusts (Membership, Procedure and Administration Arrangements) Regulations 2000 (“the PCT Regulations”) and the National Health Service Trusts (Membership and Procedure) Regulations 1990 (“the NHS trust Regulations”) to enable the Secretary of State to suspend the chairman or non-officer members of a Primary Care Trust (“PCT”), and the chairman or non-executive directors of a National Health Service trust (“NHS trust”).

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (Barred List Prescribed Information) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: Under Article 6 of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (Northern Ireland) Order 2007 the Independent Barring Board (“IBB”) must maintain the children’s and adults’ barred lists which comprise of the names of individuals barred from regulated activity with such groups. Regulations 3, 4 and 5 prescribe descriptions of other information that IBB must keep in respect of a named individual who is included in such a barred list. Other information includes information other than the name of the individual which is already retained on the barred list itself. Regulation 4 lists information provided to IBB relating to the identity of the individual and regulation 5 lists information related to IBB’s functions, including information material to the decision to bar the individual.

entry.title: The Consumers, Estate Agents and Redress Act 2007 (Commencement No. 3 and Supplementary Provision) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Consumers, Estate Agents and Redress Act 2007 (Commencement No. 3 and Supplementary Provision) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order brings into force section 5 of the Consumers, Estate Agents and Redress Act 2007 which requires the National Consumer Council to produce a forward work programme before each financial year. Article 4 modifies the definition of financial year as it applies in relation to section 5 so that the first financial year of the Council will be the period which begins on 1st October 2008 and ends on 31st March 2010.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (Transitional Provisions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: This Order, made under the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (Northern Ireland) Order 2007 (“the Order”), makes transitional provision in relation to those subject to existing restrictions relating to working with children or vulnerable adults. The Order requires the Independent Barring Board (“IBB”) established under section 1 of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 to include, or consider including, those subject to existing restrictions in the new barred lists. The individuals included in the new barred lists will not be barred from engaging in regulated activity relating to children or, as the case may be, vulnerable adults, until Article 7(2) and (3) of the Order (bar from engaging in regulated activity) comes into operation. The existing restrictions are to remain in place until then.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (Prescribed Criteria) (Transitional Provisions) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the criteria which are to have effect for the purposes of Articles 3(7) and 5(7) of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (Transitional Provisions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the TPO”). Anyone meeting these criteria will not be given the right to make representations as to their inclusion under the TPO in the barred lists (these are the lists established and maintained by the Independent Barring Board (“IBB”) under Article 6 of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (Northern Ireland) Order 2007 (“the Order”)).

entry.title: The Caledonian Maritime Assets Limited (Largs) Harbour Revision Order 2008
entry.summary: This version of the The Caledonian Maritime Assets Limited (Largs) Harbour Revision Order 2008 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

title.div: The Food Labelling (Declaration of Allergens) (Wales) Regulations 2008 / Rheoliadau Labelu Bwyd (Datgan Alergenau) (Cymru) 2008

div.p: These Regulations further amend the Food Labelling Regulations 1996 (“the principal Regulations”) in so far as they apply in relation to Wales. The principal Regulations extend to the whole of Great Britain.
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Reoliadau Labelu Bwyd 1996 (“y prif Reoliadau”) ymhellach i'r graddau y maent yn gymwys o ran Cymru. Mae'r prif Reoliadau yn rhychwantu Prydain Fawr gyfan.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (Barring Procedure) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for parts of the procedure to be followed by the Independent Barring Board (“IBB”) established under section 1 of, and Schedule 1 to, the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006.

title.div: The Education (Fees and Awards) (Wales) Regulations 2008 / Rheoliadau Addysg (Ffioedd a Dyfarniadau) (Cymru) 2008

div.p: These Regulations amend the Education (Fees and Awards) (Wales) Regulations 2007 (“the 2007 Regulations”).
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Addysg (Ffioedd a Dyfarniadau) (Cymru) 2007 (“Rheoliadau 2007”).

entry.title: The County Court (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Rules amend the County Court Rules (Northern Ireland) 1981 [ 1981 No. 225] so as to:

entry.title: The Avian Influenza (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Avian Influenza (H5N1 in Poultry) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007 (S.R. 2007 No. 207) and the Avian Influenza (H5N1 in Wild Birds) Regulations 2007 (S.R. 2007 No. 208) to add raw petfood to the lists of by-products which can be moved under the authority of a licence issued by the Department under these Regulations. The Regulations also amend the Avian Influenza (Preventive Measures) Regulations 2007 (S.R. 2007 No. 70) to require that the keeper of poultry notifies the Department in writing of details of the particulars notified to the Department under regulation 5(1) within 30 days of any request by notice from the Department.

entry.title: The Guar Gum (Restriction on First Placing on the Market) (Scotland) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to Scotland only, implement Commission Decision 2008/352/EC imposing special conditions governing guar gum originating in or consigned from India due to contamination risk of those products by pentachlorophenal and dioxins (“the Commission Decision”).

entry.title: The Food Labelling (Declaration of Allergens) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Food Labelling Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996 (“the principal Regulations”).
